title: What is a make of DVD player that will play copy protected DVDs without fail? - Quora

response.answer_text: I do not quite get what you’re asking. As far as I remember, copyright protection on DVDs is designed to prevent copied DVDs from being played. It shouldn’t prevent a legit copy from working. Region-locked DVDs do of course exist and most DVD players can be reset a few times to change the region they play. My advice if you want a DVD player that plays the biggest range of stuff? Buy a really cheap one from a brand you have never heard of. If you get a Sony, say, it will tend to be more serious about preventing you from doing stuff that Sony don’t approve of, and Sony are of course a massive content company as well as a hardware manufacturer. Get one made by someone who doesn’t much care.

You are asking for a mechanical device that will work forever without developing a fault. Such a thing does not exist. Modern DVD players have excellent error-correction. It would be unusual to find a DVD which will play in one player and not another, unless one player is failing.
